sub_title: Assistant to the Head of MRM
summary: Dedicated and experienced Assistant Manager with a proven track record in providing high-level support to senior-level executives across industries. Equipped with great interpersonal skills, strong work ethics and the ability to efficiently multitask in a fast-paced dynamic environment.  A confident, proactive and discrete professional adept to demonstrate support and leadership with an eye on the detail.  Goal oriented, pleasant, organized and efficient communicator with a cross cultural approach, liaises between managers, employees and customers with professionalism to ensure tasks are completed in time and business is run smoothly.

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Science, European Cultural Studies (2015)
Commercial Certificate in Executive Secretarial Courses, (Employee de commerce CFC)

certifications.name: Certificate in Practical Business English
certifications.authority: London Chamber of Commerce and Industry

company.name: London Chamber of Commerce and Industry

profile_positions.description:
In charge of overseeing events, activities, operations in the hotel and support the G.M. by ensuring the establishment works smoothly.   

- 	Research - implementation for a general “face-lift” of the hotel (eg. decoration, upholstery, amenities, services, promotions)  
- 	Negotiate with existing and new suppliers for quality and prices for all-purpose amenities of the hotel 
- 	Supervise the House-keeping and Maintenance Departments.  Ad-hoc solving problems
- 	Enacted interviews and created a “pool” of CVs for potential future use
- 	Overlook and ensure that excellence is granted to the events 
- 	Build up customers relations
- 	Ensure all hotel rules and policies are well implemented and excelled
profile_positions.title: Assistant Hotel Manager

profile_positions.description:
In charge of overseeing affairs related to the Chairman’s office, resolving customers concerns and problem solving before reaching the Chairman, managing an active calendar of appointments, travel plans and communicating with internal and external stakeholders for and on behalf of the Honorary Chairman of Piraeus Bank  S.A.  (a multinational financial services company and the leading bank in Greece) and Chairman of the Lyktos Group, a diversified group of companies.

-	Leverage daily operations and manage a smooth execution of the agenda, while ensuring the continuation and enhancement of services at the Chairman’s office
- 	Work, implement and consolidate proof briefing materials, for upcoming commitments and meetings 
- 	Coordinate communications with business leaders, senior government officials and media representatives
- 	Handle sensitive and confidential business and personal information with the utmost discretion
- 	Arrange business dinners, press conferences and special projects, whereas ensuring the successful handling of administrative tasks like the completion of expense reports and various others
- 	Initiate, develop and implement improvement schemes for the efficiency of the workplace by streamlining operations, prioritizing communications and by setting up operational processes, in order to facilitate the internal flow of communication
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to the Honorary Chairman

profile_positions.description:
In charge of overseeing all affairs affiliated with the I.T. internally and externally.  Commissioned to ensure the thorough internal official circulation of information top-down and between the 6 departments reporting to the G.M., while at the same time handling confidential information and managing an active agenda, business trips and social events.

-	Supervise 6 department secretaries, as ensuring communication methods, administration processes and budget reports are aligned with the Bank’s policies
-	Accelerate the communication flow within the 6 units reporting to the General Manager and ensure the efficient and effective flow of information
-	Develop and optimize strategies for improving the efficiency of the workplace and goal achievement within the units, by implementing practical business approaches  to enhance workflow processes and avoid functional deficiencies
-	Manage and present monthly budget sheets, expenses and human resource reports and associated key performance indicators to the Senior Management 
-	Coordinate key corporate business reviews for the implementation of Group I.T. projects and make sure timelines and milestones are met
-	Liaise with the various departments regarding the deployment of operational regulations to ensure adherence to the policies of the Bank
-	Steered the “integration team” and supervised the merging procedures when the Bank merged progressively with 6 more banks,  by assembling the I.T. personnel consolidation sheets and  by arranging its physical set up into new office facilities
-	Organise and coordinate the events of the I.T., including negotiating terms, pricing agreements with resorts, caterers and other service providers for, amongst others, team building activities for 1500 people
-	Trained new personnel  
-	Manage daily and smooth execution of the agenda, ensuring ad-hoc requests are dealt appropriately, while performing as the key interface with the office of the Chief Executive Officer
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to the General Manager of I.T., Funds Transfer & Central Operations

profile_positions.description:
Provide business and administrative support to the Chief Executive Officer, whilst annually organising the hospitality of the World Rally Championship teams, VIPs and guests for the Acropolis Rally of Greece.

-	Coordinate the agenda of the Chief Executive Officer, including travel arrangements, conferences
-	Supervise the smooth operation of the office,  invoicing, preparation of financial analysis and reporting for the Chief Financial Officer  
-	Preparation of company’s candidacy for its participation in financial biddings focussed on international sport events (i.e. the Olympic Games “Sydney 2000” and the Olympic Games “Athens 2004”)
-	Negotiate favourable terms and pricing condition agreements with hotels and other service providers
-	Design from scratch, promote and sell hospitality packages to the delegates of the World Rally Championships
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to the Chief Executive Officer & Hospitality Manager of the World Rally Champion

profile_positions.description:
-	Managing the agenda of the Chief Operating Officer
-	General office management activities, including managing travel arrangements and coordinating pre-planning of trips
-	Manage and verify purchase orders
-	Prepare and submit the Intrastat code of products
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to the Chief Operating Officer

profile_positions.description:
-	Managing the daily calendar of the Chief Operating Officer
-	Set up meetings, book conference rooms and arrange business dinners
-	Manage travel arrangements and coordinate trip agendas
-	Set stationery orders & general clerical duties incl. invoicing
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to the Chief Operating Officer

profile_positions.description:
-Office Management
-Liaised between departments (eg. Marketing, Accreditation, PR, Financial Dpts) for ensuring the deliverance of accurate & on-time inter-communication, as well as the proper implementation of the units’ administrative procedures
profile_positions.title: Head Of Secretariat
